title: 'Baby number three!' Sam and Billie Faiers make BIG revelation as they talk plans for 2020
text:
Wednesday night marked the finale of the most recent season of The Mummy Diaries.

And as the episode drew to a close, sisters and stars Sam and Billie Faiers teased what could be in store for them when the show returns in 2020.

Reflecting on the ups and downs of 2019, the pair declared that, even though their partners Paul Knightley and Greg Shepherd aren't enthralled by the prospect, it could be time next year for 'baby number three'.

'Baby number three!' Wednesday night's Mummy Diaries saw sisters and stars Sam and Billie Faiers teased what could be in store for them when the show returns in 2020

Both are parents to a son and daughter each: Billie shares Nelly, five, and Arthur, two, with Greg, while Sam has Paul, three, and Rosie, who turns two next month.

The rest of the episode saw Nelly bursting into tears when faced with the prospect of going back to school after the summer.

The tot - who was getting ready to enter Year 1 after spending the summer enjoying luxurious breaks in Marbella and Wales - became upset when mum Billie, 29, and dad Greg, 33, said to her: 'Why are you worried about going back into school? Come on, don't be silly. Where's all this come from? You've got to go back to school at some point.'

Greg later told the camera: 'It was completely random. She's never ever said to me she doesn't want to go back to school.'

Meanwhile, Billie said: 'She just came up to me and started crying and said she's nervous about going into Year 1 because she's not with her reception friends.

'Their classmates are going to be different, she's got a new teacher, she's not going to be the baby of the school anymore.

'She must have just been thinking about it and just got a little bit emotional bless her.

'Nelly is one of the youngest in her year. I can't believe how fast the first year of school has gone'.

Upset: The five-year-old sobbed about going back to school

Shocked: Greg was left stunned when Nelly cried her eyes out as the first day of school approached

He later told the camera: 'It was completely random. She's never ever said to me she doesn't want to go back to school'

Greg said to Nelly: 'You've got Charlotte and what's your other friend called? Scarlett. You've got loads of friends in your class.'

It's little wonder the youngster didn't want to return to school after spending the summer enjoying luxurious holidays in Marbella and the five-star Celtic Manor Resort in Newport, Wales, where the Faiers sisters were joined by mum Sue, grandma Wendy and step-dad Dave.

And Nelly and the family got a taste of the high life as they enjoyed afternoon tea, a forest jump adventure course and a luxurious spa with hot tub.

Adding to the on-screen drama, it was boys versus girls as Billie and Sam swapped paparazzi for putters to battle it out in a competition with Greg and Dave on the Twenty Ten Ryder Cup golf course.

Announcement: It's there when Dave dropped the bombshell he is set to marry his girlfriend Nicky - despite the fact he hasn't proposed yet

It's there that Dave dropped the bombshell he is set to marry his girlfriend Nicky - despite the fact that he hasn't proposed yet.

After a long, awkward silence, Billie's husband Greg said 'really?', while Sam, 28, muttered 'congratulations'.

Reflecting on the shock proposal, Billie later said in a VT: 'I mean it is a little bit out of the blue isn't it? It just sort of came out of nowhere.'

Sam added: 'Absolutely, we were all a bit shocked. We are genuinely so happy for him.'
